intro: Cnicus ruthenicus, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, along roadsides, and in waste areas.
